topic.domains: (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

section.p: This template reflects a discrete observation about a patient's allergy or intolerance. Because it is a discrete observation, it will have a statusCode of "completed". The effectiveTime, also referred to as the "biologically relevant time" is the time at which the observation holds for the patient. For a provider seeing a patient in the clinic today, observing a history of penicillin allergy that developed five years ago, the effectiveTime is five years ago. The effectiveTime of the Allergy - Intolerance Observation is the definitive indication of whether or not the underlying allergy/intolerance is resolved. If known to be resolved, then an effectiveTime/high would be present. If the date of resolution is not known, then effectiveTime/high will be present with a nullFlavor of "UNK". The agent responsible for an allergy or adverse reaction is not always a manufactured material (for example, food allergies), nor is it necessarily consumed. The following constraints reflect limitations in the base CDA R2 specification, and should be used to represent any type of responsible agent, i.e., use playingEntity classCode = "MMAT" for all agents, manufactured or not.

ol.li:
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] templateId ( CONF:1098-7381, CONF:1098-10488, CONF:1098-32526 ) such that it
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @root="2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.7"
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @extension="2014-06-09"
SHALL conform to Allergy Observation template (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.7)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] @negationInd (CONF:1098-31526)
Note: Use negationInd="true" to indicate that the allergy was not observed.
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code (CONF:1098-15947)/@code="ASSERTION" Assertion (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.4 HL7ActCode) (CONF:1098-15948, CONF:1098-32153)

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] value with @xsi:type="CD", which SHALL be selected from ValueSet Allergy/Adverse Event Type 2.16.840.1.113883.3.88.12.3221.6.2 DYNAMIC (CONF:1098-7390)
Note: The consumable participant points to the precise allergen or substance of intolerance. Because the consumable and the reaction are more clinically relevant than a categorization of the allergy/adverse event type, many systems will simply assign a fixed value here (e.g. "allergy to substance").
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] statusCode (CONF:1098-19084)/@code="completed" Completed (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.14 ActStatus) (CONF:1098-19085)

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] effectiveTime (CONF:1098-7387)
Note: If the allergy/intolerance is known to be resolved, but the date of resolution is not known, then the high element SHALL be present, and the nullFlavor attribute SHALL be set to 'UNK'.

SHOULD contain [0..*] author such that it (CONF:1098-31143)
Conforms to Author Participation (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.119)

SHOULD contain [0..*] entryRelationship such that it (CONF:1098-7447, CONF:1098-7907, CONF:1098-15955)
Contains @typeCode="MFST" MFST
Conforms to Reaction Observation2 (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.9:2014-06-09)

SHOULD contain [0..1] entryRelationship such that it (CONF:1098-9961, CONF:1098-9962, CONF:1098-15956, DSTU:710)
Contains @typeCode="SUBJ" SUBJ
Conforms to Severity Observation2 (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.8:2014-06-09)

contains [0..*] entryRelationship such that it
Conforms to Allergy Status Observation (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.28)

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] participant such that it (CONF:1098-7402)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @typeCode/@code="CSM" Consumable (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.90 HL7ParticipationType) (CONF:7403, R2.0=CONF:1098-7403)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] participantRole such that it (CONF:1098-7404)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode/@code="MANU" Manufactured Product (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.110 HL7RoleClass) (CONF:7405, R2.0=CONF:1098-7405)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] playingEntity such that it (CONF:1098-7406)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="MMAT" (CONF:7407, R2.0=CONF:7407)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code (CONF:1098-7419)
MAY satisfy: This constraint is being overridden as it has been removed in v2 and should never fire
MAY satisfy: This constraint is being overridden as it has been removed in v2 and should never fire
MAY satisfy: This constraint is being overridden as it has been removed in v2 and should never fire
MAY satisfy: This constraint is being overridden as it has been removed in v2 and should never fire
MAY satisfy: This constraint is being overridden as it has been removed in v2 and should never fire
MAY satisfy: This constraint is being overridden as it has been removed in v2 and should never fire

SHOULD contain [0..1] entryRelationship such that it (CONF:1098-32910, CONF:1098-32911, CONF:1098-32913)
Contains @typeCode="SUBJ" SUBJ
Conforms to Criticality Observation (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.145)
MAY satisfy: This constraint is being overridden as it has been removed in v2 and should never fire
MAY satisfy: This constraint is being overridden as it has been removed in v2 and should never fire
MAY satisfy: This constraint is being overridden as it has been removed in v2 and should never fire
MAY satisfy: This constraint is being overridden as it has been removed in v2 and should never fire
MAY satisfy: This constraint is being overridden as it has been removed in v2 and should never fire
entryRelationship with target entry Reaction Observation (V2) SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @inversionInd="true" True (CONF:1098-7449)
entryRelationship with target entry Severity Observation (V2) SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @inversionInd="true" True (CONF:1098-9964, DSTU:710)
entryRelationship with target entry Criticality Observation SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @inversionInd="true" True (CONF:1098-32912)
